channel.title: Another Rambo :D
channel.description:
Rambo: [url='https://www.empireonline.com/news/feed.asp?NID=25714']https://www.empireonline.com/news/feed.asp?NID=25714[/url]
Bad Boys 3? [url='https://www.empireonline.com/news/story.asp?NID=25713']https://www.empireonline.com/news/story.asp?NID=25713[/url]
What did you guys think of the recently released Rambo?

item.title: Another Rambo :D
item.dc:creator: Angdraug
item.description:
But it is still going to end badly after someone decides to pour gasoline on the water.

Read full topic

item.title: Another Rambo :D
item.dc:creator: raw_bean
item.description:
As long as you kept on rotating on an axis perpendicular to the poles of fire and flood, you’d remain pleasantly temperate.

Read full topic

item.title: Another Rambo :D
item.dc:creator: JohnKiller118
item.description:
DansonDelta40:

Wait, let me guess: Fictional horrifying death is hilarious, while real horrifying death is rather unpleasant? Did I get it right? Cookie for me?

The difference is simple: Fictional deaths aren’t real deaths. It’s all Special Effects. Remember the part in Tropic Thunder where the director steps on a mine and he gibs? Hilarious! Unless it’s a snuff film, you can enjoy it without giving a second thought!

But watching a real person really die a bloody gibby death, is very unpleasant. Because you know that it was real, and you know he’s really dead. Did anyone see the video about the Vietnam guy burning himself because he was protesting against the persecution of Buddhists by South Vietnam’s Ngô Đình Diệm administration? It’s very sad, and I almost cried, but the man’s a hero.

DansonDelta40:

No, no, NO! I WON’T believe that everyone here failed to see the irony pouring out of every single word in that quote!

Of course I know the difference between fiction and reality. Unlike some fundamental Christians I happen to know IRL. It just seemed kinda strange to me that people can laugh at a fictional character dying in the most horrible way, while they would rather puke or at least become “sick in their belly” (sorry I have no better expression for it) if seeing the same happen to a real person in real life. I just think it is odd. No offence meant.

And no, I am sure I never suggested Bonus Levels to be added to Black Mesa. But I certainly was a whiny bitch during my first three or four flame attacks on this forum. Probably because I was not used to such an amount of unprovoked hostility. You don’t have that on German forums very often.

Now that I have got used to it and keep thinking of you all as a bunch of morons ready to jump at each opportunity to flame me to death, I am getting along a lot better.

Thanks for asking.

Fuuuuuuu…

Read full topic

item.title: Another Rambo :D
item.dc:creator: mattemuse
item.description:
sersoft:

If gore in movies makes you sick you should watch the SAW series, then the HOSTEL movies followed by the new Final Destination in 3D, after that you should be fine.

No, if after you watched all those movies you were to watch Tokyo Gore Police, you would still flip your shit. :fffuuu:

Read full topic

item.title: Another Rambo :D
item.dc:creator: raw_bean
item.description:
Raminator:

I don’t draw a distinction between real and imaginary violence. Shit’s funny so long as it’s not happening to you.

Oh, you.

Although I recall when someone took that attitude in a thread about the bush fires in Australia back a while they damn near got banned and had half the forums ready to burn down their house for their insensitivity.

Read full topic

item.title: Another Rambo :D
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
Bscly.

Heck, sometimes it’s funny when it is happening to you. Like if it’s your own fault for J-walking and getting hit by a bus, or for trying Kung-Fu on a guy with a gun.

But in real life…

Anywaay.
I haven’t seen Rambo yet. I might do soon.

I don’t think anyone missed the irony.

And what’s so odd about that?
Fictional gore doesn’t make me sick because it is not real. Real gore makes me sick because of obvious reasons.

item.title: Another Rambo :D
item.dc:creator: DansonDelta40
item.description:
Wait, let me guess: Fictional horrifying death is hilarious, while real horrifying death is rather unpleasant? Did I get it right? Cookie for me?

No, no, NO! I WON’T believe that everyone here failed to see the irony pouring out of every single word in that quote!

Of course I know the difference between fiction and reality. Unlike some fundamental Christians I happen to know IRL. It just seemed kinda strange to me that people can laugh at a fictional character dying in the most horrible way, while they would rather puke or at least become “sick in their belly” (sorry I have no better expression for it) if seeing the same happen to a real person in real life. I just think it is odd. No offence meant.

And no, I am sure I never suggested Bonus Levels to be added to Black Mesa. But I certainly was a whiny bitch during my first three or four flame attacks on this forum. Probably because I was not used to such an amount of unprovoked hostility. You don’t have that on German forums very often.

Now that I have got used to it and keep thinking of you all as a bunch of morons ready to jump at each opportunity to flame me to death, I am getting along a lot better.

Thanks for asking.

item.title: Another Rambo :D
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
I liked the last rambo movie, it was nice to finally see rambo in full HD instead of blurry old movie quality… Apart from the awesome fight scenes, all the nature shots were beautiful due to HD.

item.title: Another Rambo :D
item.dc:creator: klaymore
item.description:
DansonDelta40:

Have you seen that video of US Soldiers in Iraq (or Afghanistan) tossing a little puppy into a canyon?

You should go look for it - sounds like something you could find hilarious.

ooh rah marine corps

killing puppys till the sun goes down

item.title: Another Rambo :D
item.dc:creator: Ibanez
item.description:
DansonDelta40:

Wait, let me guess: Fictional horrifying death is hilarious, while real horrifying death is rather unpleasant? Did I get it right? Cookie for me?

Haven’t we been over this before? I’m getting a horrible feeling of déjà vu… You know, the part where you completely failed to realize that fiction =/= real life.

Read full topic

item.title: Another Rambo :D
item.dc:creator: CaLeB
item.description:
DansonDelta40:

So, basically, a movie is worth seeing if people in there get killed in horrible and disgusting ways?

If that was the case, then the Saw series wouldn’t be so hated on right about now. XD

Read full topic

item.title: Another Rambo :D
item.dc:creator: shifty
item.description:
Ramirezoid:

That one asshole made our entire military look like shit.

I know that it looked awful that he killed a poor innocent puppy but how is that bad versus say some Soldiers just purposely slaughtering civilians(Note: this is just an example im not going all political or saying anything about the two US wars)

DansonDelta40:

Wait, let me guess: Fictional horrifying death is hilarious, while real horrifying death is rather unpleasant? Did I get it right? Cookie for me?

Yeah it is. Because fictional people aren’t ‘real’ so therefore if you killed something that wasn’t real you didn’t really kill anything at all. Whereas in reality the person has a family that could grieve over them, authorities get involved and if you dont have the mind of a killer you’ll start to feel guilty or any other bad consequences of your actions will happen

Read full topic

item.description:
DansonDelta40:

Wait, let me guess: Fictional horrifying death is hilarious, while real horrifying death is rather unpleasant? Did I get it right? Cookie for me?

Weren’t you the one whining about how all 'Mericans are savages who tote around Tec-9’s and 12-guages, blowing off childrens heads when no one agreed on your idea to put bonus levels into the mod?

So I take it you won’t be playing Black Mesa either?
I mean, what’s the difference of blowing people people to bits in a video game and blowing people to bits in real life?

Have you seen that video of US Soldiers in Iraq (or Afghanistan) tossing a little puppy into a canyon?
